intro: Hieracium glehnii, commonly known as Glehn's hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has basal rosettes of leaves and produces yellow flowers that are often visited by pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
